&appname; is a simple application for viewing images on your phone.
With no bells or whistles, this application is the simplest slideshow application on the market.
You can view the source code, log bugs or request features on Github.
This application is completely free and open source; licensed under the MIT license.
Thank you to Yan Tsui for testing and designing the &appname; icon.
This translation of &appname; is brought to you by &author;.
Displays files that are hidden by other file managers.
Displays thumbnail images. Turning this off will increase performance, however you will not be able to see which files are images and which are not.
When opened, &appname; will start in the location that a slideshow was last used.
When opened, &appname; will start a slideshow from the last image that was displayed.

The "Play from here" button appears in the file list and allow you to begin a slideshow from the current folder, including all sub folders. This feature is disabled by default as it may have a negative performance impact.
Automatically play GIFs when displayed. Requires Glide image loading.

Enable navigation to the root directory of the device. This will enable access to files anywhere on the device, including mounted storage such as SD cards. Note: May require a rooted device to work correctly.
Click to change the number of seconds an image will be shown before changing to the next image.

Use Glide to load images. Glide has support for other features, such as preloading and GIF support. Turning this off will enable to old custom image loading strategy. This has better performance on some devices.
Load the next image during the current slide. Disabling this feature may increase performance on some devices. Requires Glide image loading.
Automatically rotate images into landscape mode when the image is wider than it is high.
Skip images that take too long to load during slideshow. A notification will be displayed when this happens.
Overlay image details during slideshow when paused.
Overlay image details during slideshow when slideshow is running.
Stop the slideshow once every image has been shown.
Display the images in the slideshow in reverse order.
Display the images in the slideshow in a random order.
Display a warning pop up before deleting an image. Disable at your own risk.
